title.en: God Speaks and the World Is Formed

en: God creates the world not through struggle, but through His word.
Everything begins because God speaks, and what He commands comes into being.

lines: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
The earth was without form and empty,
and darkness covered the deep.
The Spirit of God was moving over the waters.
The Prophet David said:
“By the word of the Lord the heavens were made,
and by the breath of His mouth all their host.
He spoke, and it came to be;
He commanded, and it stood firm.”
God said,
“Let the waters be gathered together,
and let dry land appear.”
And it was so.
God said,
“Let the land produce plants and trees,
each bearing seed according to its kind.”
And it was so.
God said,
“Let the land bring forth living creatures,
each according to its kind.”
And God saw that it was good.
Then God said,
“Let us make the human being in Our image.”
The Lord formed the man from the dust of the ground
and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life,
and the man became a living being.

question.en: What do you notice about the way God creates and gives life in this passage?
